The king of Tirzah: 1
Total number of all kings: 31
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joshua had grown old, having lived many years, the Lord told him, “You are old and have lived many years, but much of the land still remains to be possessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This territory remains: all of the Philistine regions, including all Geshurite holdings
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the Shihor east of Egypt as far as the border of Ekron on the north (which is considered part of Canaan). This includes the five rulers of the Philistines, the Gazites, the Ashdodites, the Ashkelonites, the Gittites, the Ekronites, and the Avvites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “To the south, there remains to be conquered all the territory held by the Canaanites, Mearah that belongs to the Sidonians, as far as Aphek, to the border of the Amorites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: including the territory of the Gebalites and all of Lebanon facing the east from Baal-gad at the foot of Mount Hermon as far as Lebo-hamath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the inhabitants of the hill country from Lebanon to Misrephoth-maim, including all the Sidonians. I myself will drive them out in the presence of the Israelis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You only have to allocate the land as an inheritance, just as I commanded you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Reuben and descendants of Gad, along with the other half-tribe of Manasseh, received their inherited portion that Moses the servant of the Lord had given them to the east beyond the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Specifically included was from Aroer on the banks of the Wadi Arnon, and the town that lies in the middle of the valley, including all the plains from Medeba to Dibon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the cities pertaining to King Sihon of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, as far as the boundary of the Ammonite territory,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gilead and the region belonging to the descendants of Geshur and Maacath, including all of Mount Hermon, and all of Bashan as far as Salecah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also included was the entire kingdom of Og in Bashan, who reigned in Ashtaroth and Edrei. (He was the sole survivor left of the Rephaim.) Although Moses had defeated these people and driven them out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Israelis did not drive out the descendants of Geshur or the descendants of Maacath—Geshur and Maacath live within the territory of Israel to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses allotted no inheritance solely to the tribe of Levi. As he had mentioned to them, the offerings by fire to the Lord God of Israel are their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses allocated territory to the tribe of the descendants of Reuben according to their tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their allocation was from the border of Aroer on the edge of the Arnon valley (including the city that is located in the valley, as well as the entire plain next to Medeba),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heshbon and all of its cities that are on the plain, including Dibon, Bamoth-baal, Beth-baal-meon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jahaz, Kedemoth, Mephaath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kiriathaim, Sibmah, and Zereth-shahar on the hill in the valley,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth-peor, the slopes of Pisgah, Beth-jeshimoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all of the cities of the plain, the entire kingdom of King Sihon of the Amorites, who used to reign in Heshbon and whom Moses attacked, along with the chiefs of Midian, Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, nobles of Sihon who lived in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelis also killed Beor’s son Balaam, the occult practitioner, executing him with a sword as one of those killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border of the descendants of Reuben was the Jordan River and its banks. This was the inheritance belonging to the descendants of Reuben, divided according to their families, cities, and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses also allocated territory to the tribe of Gad, that is, to the descendants of Gad, according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their territory included Jazer, all the cities of Gilead, half the land of the Ammonites as far as Aroer which is located near Rabbah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Heshbon as far as Ramath-mizpeh and Betonim, from Mahanaim as far as the border of Debir,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the valley containing Beth-haram, Beth-nimrah, Succoth, and Zaphon, the rest of the kingdom of King Sihon of Heshbon, with the Jordan River as its border as far as the southern end of the Sea of Galilee beyond the Jordan River to the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the inheritance belonging to the descendants of Gad according to their tribes, cities, and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses also allocated territory to the half-tribe of Manasseh, that is, for the half-tribe of the descendants of Manasseh according to their tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their territory extended from Mahanaim to include all of Bashan, all of the kingdom of King Og of Bashan, all of the 60 towns of Jair there in Bashan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: half of Gilead, including Ashtaroth and Edrei. The cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan went to half of the descendants of Manasseh’s son Machir, according to their tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the allotments that Moses apportioned for an inheritance in the plains of Moab beyond the Jordan River east of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses allotted no inheritance to the tribe of Levi. The Lord God of Israel is their inheritance, as he promised them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Israelis inherited in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest, Nun’s son Joshua, and the heads of the families of the Israelis allotted to them as an inheritance
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by lot, just as the Lord commanded through Moses for the nine tribes and the half-tribe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since Moses had given the inheritance of the two tribes and the half-tribe across the Jordan River. However, he did not give an inheritance to the descendants of Levi who lived among them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since the descendants of Joseph constituted two tribes—Manasseh and Ephraim. They did not allot a portion to the descendants of Levi in the land, since they were given cities to live in, along with pastures for their livestock and property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Israelis did just as the Lord had commanded Moses—they divided the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, the descendants of Judah approached Joshua in Gilgal. Jephunneh the Kenizzite’s son Caleb told him, “You know the promise that the Lord gave Moses the man of God concerning the two of us in Kadesh-barnea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was 40 years old when Moses the servant of the Lord sent me from Kadesh-barnea to scout the land. I brought back an honest report to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As it happened, my fellow Israelis who went up with me terrified the people, but I fully followed the Lord my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses made a promise to me on that day when he said, ‘The land that you covered on foot will certainly be your inheritance. It will belong to your descendants forever, because you have fully followed the Lord my God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Look how the Lord has let me survive, as you can see, these 45 years since the time when the Lord said this through Moses, while Israel was wandering through the wilderness. And look! I’m here today—my eighty-fifth birthday!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m still as strong today as I was the day Moses commissioned me. I’m as strong today as I was then, and I can go out to battle and come back successful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then, give me that hill country about which the Lord spoke back on that day, because you yourself heard back then that the Anakim were there, with great reinforced cities. Perhaps the Lord will be with me and I will expel them, just as the Lord said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua blessed him and gave Hebron to Jephunneh’s son Caleb for his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Hebron became the inheritance of Jephunneh the Kenizzite’s son Caleb, and it remains so today, because he fully followed the Lord God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hebron used to be known as Kiriath-arba, after the greatest man among the Anakim. After all of this, the land enjoyed rest from war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said, “Now the allotment for the tribe of the descendants of Judah, allocated according to their families, will extend to the border of Edom, southward to the wilderness of Zin until land’s end,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then from the southern end of the Dead Sea, that is, from the bay that orients toward the Negev,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: proceeding south to the ascent of Akrabbim, then continuing to Zin, and from there up along the south of Kadesh-barnea to Hezron, and from there up to Addar and then to Karka,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: passing along to Azmon toward the Wadi of Egypt and ending at the sea. This will be your southern border.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eastern border was the Dead Sea as far as the mouth of the Jordan River. The border of the north side extended from the bay of the sea at the mouth of the Jordan River
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: toward Beth-hoglah, and continuing on the north of Beth-arabah. The border ascended up to the boundary marker set up by Reuben’s son Bohan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The boundary then went up to Debir from the Achor valley and turned north toward Gilgal opposite the ascent of Adummim in the southern part of the valley. Then the border continued to the waters of En-shemesh and terminated at En-rogel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the border proceeded up the valley of Ben-hinnom to the southern ascent of the Jebusites (that is, to Jerusalem), and from there to the top of the mountain that faces the valley of Hinnom to the west at the end of the valley of Rephaim toward the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border proceeded from the top of the mountain to the spring of the waters of Nephtoah, then to the cities of Mount Ephron, and then the border curved toward Baalah (also known as Kiriath-jearim).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border turned west from Baalah to Mount Seir, continuing to the top of Mount Jearim on the north (also known as Chesalon), and then proceeded to Beth-shemesh, continuing through Timnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border proceeded north to the edge of Ekron, then curved to Shikkeron and on to Mount Baalah, proceeding then to Jabneel, where the boundary ended at the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The western border was at the Mediterranean Sea coastline. This is the border that surrounded the territory of the descendants of Judah, according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joshua gave an allotment among the descendants of Judah to Jephunneh’s son Caleb, just as God told Joshua, Kiriath-arba, which was named after the ancestor of Anak (that is, Hebron).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there Caleb drove the three descendants of Anak, Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai—the Anakim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went up from there to attack the inhabitants of Debir. (Debir was formerly known as Kiriath-sepher.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Caleb announced, “I will give my daughter Achsah in marriage to the one who attacks Kiriath-sepher and captures it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Othniel, the son of Caleb’s brother Kenaz, captured it, so Caleb gave him his daughter Achsah as his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sometime later, she came to Othniel and persuaded him to ask her father for a field.
As she dismounted from her donkey, Caleb asked her, “What do you want?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She replied, “Give me a blessing. Since you have given me the land of the Negev, give me also some springs of water.” So he gave her the upper and lower springs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here’s a list of cities allotted for the tribe of the descendants of Judah according to their families:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cities to the far south of the tribe of the descendants of Judah (toward the border of Edom in the south) included Kabzeel, Eder, Jagur,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kinah, Dimonah, Adadah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedesh, Hazor, Ithnan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ziph, Telem, Bealoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazor-hadattah, Kerioth-hezron (also known as Hazor),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amam, Shema, Moladah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazar-gaddah, Heshmon, Beth-pelet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazar-shual, Beer-sheba, Biziothiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Baalah, Iim, Ezem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eltolad, Chesil, Hormah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ziklag, Madmannah, Sansannah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain, and Rimmon, for a total of 29 cities and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lowland cities included Eshtaol, Zorah, Ashnah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zanoah, En-gannim, Tappuach, Enam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jarmuth, Adullam, Socoh, Azekah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shaaraim, Adithaim, Gederah, and Gederothaim, for a total of fourteen cities and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also included were Zenan, Hadashah, Migdal-gad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dilan, Mizpeh, Joktheel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lachish, Bozkath, Eglon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cabbon, Lahmam, Chitlish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gederoth, Beth-dagon, Naamah, and Makkedah, for a total of sixteen cities and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also included were Libnah, Ether, Ashan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iphtah, Ashnah, Nezib,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keilah, Achzib, and Mareshah, for a total of nine cities and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also included were Ekron, with its towns and villages,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Ekron to the Mediterranean Sea, including everything by the edge of Ashdod, along with their villages,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ashdod and its towns and villages, Gaza and its towns and villages as far as the River of Egypt, and the coastline of the Mediterranean Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hill country included Shamir, Jattir, Socoh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dannah, Kiriath-sannah (also known as Debir),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anab, Eshtemoh, Anim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Goshen, Holon, Giloh, for a total of eleven cities and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also included were Arab, Dumah, Eshan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Janum, Beth-tappuach, Aphekah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Humtah, Kiriath-arba (also known as Hebron), and Zior, for a total of nine cities and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also included were Maon, Carmel, Ziph, Juttah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jezreel, Jokdeam, Zanoah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah, for a total of ten cities and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also included were Halhul, Beth-zur, Gedor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Maarath, Beth-anoth, and Eltekon, for a total of six cities and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also included were Kiriath-baal (also known as Kiriath-jearim) and Rabbah, for a total of two cities and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wilderness included Beth-arabah, Middin, Secacah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nibshan, Salt City, and En-gedi, for a total of six cities and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as for the Jebusites who lived in Jerusalem, the descendants of Judah could not expel them, so Jebusites live with the descendants of Judah in Jerusalem to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The territorial allotment for the descendants of Joseph proceeded from the Jordan River by Jericho eastward of the Jericho waters into the wilderness, proceeding from Jericho through the hill country of Bethel
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from Bethel to Luz, continuing to the border of the Archites at Ataroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It proceeded westward to the territory of the Japhletites as far as the territory of lower Beth-horon, then toward Gezer, ending at the Mediterranean Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Manasseh and Ephraim, the descendants of Joseph, received their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the territory allocated to the descendants of Ephraim according to their families: the border of their inheritance on the east was Ataroth-addar as far as upper Beth-horon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the border proceeded west from Michmethath on the north, then turned east toward Taanath-shiloh, continuing to the east of Janoah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It proceeded from Janoah to Ataroth, then to Naarah, then proceeded to Jericho and ended at the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Tappuach, the border proceeded west to the Kanah brook, ending at the Mediterranean Sea. This is the inheritance of the tribe of the descendants of Ephraim according to their families,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with the cities that had been set aside for the descendants of Ephraim within the allotment of the descendants of Manasseh, including all of the cities and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, they did not drive out the Canaanites who lived in Gezer, so the Canaanites live within the territory of Ephraim to this day, but they serve as forced laborers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The territorial allotment for the tribe of Manasseh, the firstborn of Joseph, was allocated first to Machir the firstborn of Manasseh and father of Gilead. Since he had been a man of war, Gilead and Bashan were allocated to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now allotments were made with respect to the remaining descendants of Manasseh according to their families: for the descendants of Abiezer, the descendants of Helek, the descendants of Asriel, the descendants of Shechem, the descendants of Hepher, and the descendants of Shemida—the male descendants of Joseph’s son Manasseh, according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hepher’s son Zelophehad, grandson of Gilead and great-grandson of Manasseh’s son Machir had no sons, only daughters. These are the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They appeared before Eleazar the priest and Nun’s son Joshua and declared, “The Lord commanded Moses to give us an inheritance among our relatives.” So in keeping what the Lord had commanded, he gave them an inheritance among their ancestor’s relatives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why ten allotments fell to Manasseh, besides the land of Gilead and Bashan beyond the Jordan River,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since the granddaughters of Manasseh received an inheritance along with his sons. (The land of Gilead belonged to the rest of the descendants of Manasseh.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border of Manasseh proceeded from Asher to Michmethath east of Shechem, then turned south to include the inhabitants of En-tappuach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The territory of Tappuach belonged to Manasseh, but Tappuach itself, on the border of Manasseh, was allocated to the descendants of Ephraim.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border proceeded to the Kanah brook and proceeded south. These cities belonged to Ephraim among the cities of Manasseh, with the border of Manasseh on the north of the brook, terminating at the Mediterranean Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The southern area was allocated to Ephraim and the northern area to Manasseh. The Mediterranean Sea was the border, extending to Asher on the North and to Issachar on the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Issachar and Asher, Manasseh held Beth-shean and its towns, Ibleam and its towns, the inhabitants of En-dor and its towns, the inhabitants of Taanach and its towns, and the inhabitants of Megiddo and its towns, and the three coastal districts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Manasseh did not take possession of these cities, because the Canaanites predominated in that territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later on, when the Israelis had become strong, they forced the Canaanites to work for them, but they never did expel them completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, the descendants of Joseph asked Joshua, “Why did you give us only one allotment and portion for an inheritance, since we’re numerous and the Lord has blessed us all along?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua replied to them, “Since you’re so numerous, go up to the forest and clear ground there for yourselves in the territory where the Perizzites and Rephaim are, because the hill country of Ephraim is too narrow for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Joseph replied, “The hill country isn’t sufficient for us, but all the Canaanites who live on the plain have iron chariots, both those in Beth-shean and its villages as well as the inhabitants of the Jezreel Valley.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua told the tribes of Joseph, which were Ephraim and Manasseh, “You’re truly a numerous group, and you have great power. You are not to have only one allotment,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the hill country will also belong to you. Even though it’s a forest, you will clear it and possess it to its farthest borders. You’ll drive out the Canaanites, even though they have iron chariots and even though they’re strong.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, the entire assembly of the Israelis gathered together at Shiloh and set up the Tent of Meeting there, where the land lay conquered before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven tribes remained among the Israelis for whom their inheritances had not yet been allocated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua told the Israelis, “How long will you delay invading and taking possession of the land that the Lord God of your ancestors has given you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Appoint three men from each tribe and I’ll send them. They’ll begin to go through the land and record a description of it, categorized according to their inheritance, and then they’ll report back to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They’ll divide it seven ways. Judah will stay in its territory on the south and the house of Joseph will remain in its territory on the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lay out the land in seven divisions, then bring your report here to me. I will then cast lots in the presence of the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Levi have no allotment among you, since the priesthood of the Lord is their inheritance. Gad, Reuben, and the half-tribe of Manasseh received their inheritance to the east, beyond the Jordan River given to them by Moses the servant of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the men started out, following Joshua’s command to those who went to scout the land, “Go through the land and record a description of it, and then return to me. I will then cast lots in the presence of the Lord your God in Shiloh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men left camp and went throughout the land, describing its cities in a book with seven divisions. Then they returned to Joshua at the camp at Shiloh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua threw lots in Shiloh in the Lord’s presence and divided the land accordingly among the Israelis according to their divisions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The allotment of the tribe of the descendants of Benjamin came up according to their families, and their territorial allotment fell between the descendants of Judah and the descendants of Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their border started on the north side at the Jordan River, proceeded to the slope of Jericho on the north, then westward through the hill country, and terminated at the wilderness of Beth-aven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there the boundary proceeded south in the direction of Luz to the slope of Luz (also known as Bethel), then proceeded to Ataroth-addar, on the mountain that lies south of Lower Beth-horon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there the boundary changed direction, turning southward on the western side opposite Beth-horon, terminating at Kiriath-baal (also known as Kiriath-jearim), which belongs to Judah. This formed the western boundary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The southern boundary began at the edge of Kiriath-jearim, proceeding from there to Ephron and then to the spring at the Nephtoah Waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there the boundary proceeded to the border of the mountain that overlooks the Ben-hinnom Valley at the northern end of the Rephaim Valley, where it proceeded down the Hinnom Valley south of the slope of the Jebusites toward En-rogel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it turned north toward En-shemesh and proceeded from there to Geliloth opposite the ascent of Adummim, where it turned toward the Stone of Bohan, Reuben’s son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and proceeded north of the slope of Beth-arabah down to the Arabah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there the boundary proceeded to north of the slope of Beth-hoglah and terminated at the northern bay of the Salt Sea where the Jordan River ends in the south. This was the southern border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jordan River formed its boundary on the east. This is the inheritance for the tribe of Benjamin according to its families, boundary by boundary around the entire territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The towns belonging to the tribe of Benjamin according to their families were Jericho, Beth-hoglah, Emek-keziz,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth-arabah, Zemaraim, Bethel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Avvim, Parah, Ophrah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Chephar-ammoni, Ophni, and Geba, for a total of twelve towns and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also included were Gibeon, Ramah, Beeroth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mizpeh, Chephirah, Mozah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rekem, Irpeel, Taralah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zela, Haeleph, Jebus (also known as Jerusalem), Gibeah, and Kiriath-jearim, for a total of fourteen towns and villages. This is the inheritance of the tribe of Benjamin according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second lottery went to the tribe of Simeon according to its families. Its inheritance was enclosed within the inheritance of the tribe of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its inheritance included Beer-sheba (also known as Shebah), Moladah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazar-shual, Balah, Ezem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eltolad, Bethul, Hormah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ziklag, Beth-marcaboth, Hazar-susah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth-lebaoth, and Sharuhen, for a total of thirteen towns and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also included were Ain, Rimmon, Ether, and Ashan, for a total of four towns and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also included were all the surrounding villages as far as Baalath-beer, in Ramah of the Negev. This was the inheritance of the tribe of Simeon, according to its families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The inheritance of the tribe of Simeon was contained in part of the territory of Judah; that is, because the portion allotted to the tribe of Judah was large enough for both tribes, the tribe of Simeon obtained an inheritance within that of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third lottery went to the tribe of Zebulun according to its families. The boundary of its inheritance extended to Sarid,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then turned westward toward Maralah, proceeding to Dabbesheth, and then to the valley that is east of Jokneam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Sarid it proceeded back eastward, creating a sunrise boundary at Chisloth-tabor, and proceeded from there to Daberath, then to Japhia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from which it proceeded toward the east to Gath-hepher, then to Eth-kazin, then going to Rimmon, where it turned toward Neah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the north of Neah, the boundary turned toward Hannathon, terminating at Iphtah-el Valley
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Kattath, Nahalal, Shimron, Idalah, and Bethlehem, for a total of twelve towns and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These towns and villages are the inheritance of the tribe of Zebulun according to its families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourth lottery went to the tribe of Issachar according to its families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The territorial allotment included Jezreel, Chesulloth, Shunem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hapharaim, Shion, Anaharath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rabbith, Kishion, Ebez,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remeth, En-gannim, En-haddah, Beth-pazzez,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with the boundary including Tabor, Shahazumah, and Beth-shemesh. The boundary terminated at the Jordan River, for a total of sixteen towns and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These towns and villages comprise the inheritance of the tribe of Issachar, according to its families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth lottery went to the tribe of Asher according to its families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The territorial boundary included Helkath, Hali, Beten, Achshaph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Allammelech, Amad, and Mishal, and on the west Carmel and Shihor-libnath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then proceeded east to Beth-dagon. It proceeded to Zebulun and the Iphtah-el Valley, turned north to Beth-emek and Neiel, then proceeded north to Cabul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ebron, Rehob, Hammon, and Kanah as far as Great Sidon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There the boundary turned toward Ramah, reaching to the fortress city of Tyre and turned to Hosah, where it terminated at the Mediterranean Sea. Also included were Mahalab, Achzib,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ummah, Aphek, and Rehob, for a total of 22 towns and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These towns and villages are the inheritance of the tribe of Asher according to its families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixth lottery went to the tribe of Naphtali according to its families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The territorial boundary proceeded from Heleph, the oak in Zaanannim, and Adami-nekeb, and Jabneel as far as Lakkum, terminating at the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There the boundary proceeded west to Aznoth-tabor and then to Hukkok, reaching Zebulun at the south, Asher on the west, and Judah on the east at the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also included were the fortress towns of Ziddim, Zer, Hammath, Rakkath, Chinnereth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adamah, Ramah, Hazor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedesh, Edrei, En-hazor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iron, Migdal-el, Horem, Beth-anath, and Beth-shemesh, for a total of nineteen towns and their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These towns and villages comprised the inheritance of the tribe of Naphtali according to its families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh lottery went to the tribe of Dan according to its families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The territorial allotment included Zorah, Eshtaol, Ir-shemesh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shaalabbin, Aijalon, Ithlah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elon, Timnah, Ekron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eltekeh, Gibbethon, Baalath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehud, Bene-berak, Gath-rimmon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Me-jarkon, and Rakkon at the border near Joppa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, when the descendants of Dan lost their territory, they went up and attacked Leshem. After they captured it and executed its inhabitants, they took possession of it and settled there, renaming the city of Leshem to Dan in memory of their ancestor Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These towns and villages comprised the inheritance of the tribe of Dan according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Israelis had completed distribution of the various territories of the land as inheritances, they provided an inheritance to Nun’s son Joshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By a command from the Lord, they allocated the town that he requested, Timnath-serah in the hill country of Ephraim. He rebuilt the town and settled there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the inheritances that Eleazar the priest, Nun’s son Joshua, and the heads of the families of the Israeli tribes distributed by lot in the Lord’s presence at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting. So they finished dividing the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Joshua,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the people of Israel to set apart cities of refuge about which I spoke to you through Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that anyone who kills a person unintentionally and without premeditation may run there and be protected from closely related avengers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He may run to one of those cities, stand at the entrance to the city gate, and tell his side of the story to the elders of the city. They are to bring him inside the city with them and provide him a place to live among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if the closely related avenger pursues him, then they are not to hand the killer over to him, because he killed his neighbor without premeditation and without hating him beforehand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is to live in that city until he stands trial before the community, until the death of the one who is high priest at that time. Then the killer may return to his own city and to his own home, that is, to the city from which he fled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they set apart Kedesh in Galilee in the hill country of Naphtali, Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, and Kiriath-arba (also known as Hebron) in the hill country of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: East of Jericho beyond the Jordan River, they reserved Bezer in the wilderness on the plain from the tribe of Reuben, Ramoth in Gilead from the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan from the tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were appointed to be cities for all the Israelis and for the foreigner who lives among them, so that whoever kills anyone unintentionally may run there and not die at the hands of a closely related avenger until he stands for trial before the community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the family leaders of the descendants of Levi approached Eleazar the priest and Nun’s son Joshua, along with the family leaders of the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was at Shiloh in the land of Canaan that they told them, “The Lord ordered through Moses that we be given cities in which to live, along with their pasture lands for our livestock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, just as the Lord had said, the Israelis set aside cities for the descendants of Levi from a portion of their own inheritances, along with their grazing lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lottery went to the families of the descendants of Kohath. So the descendants of Aaron the priest, who were descendants of Levi, received thirteen cities by random lot from the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the descendants of Kohath received ten cities by random lot from the families of the tribes of Ephraim, Dan, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Gershon received thirteen cities by random lot from the families of the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and from the half-tribe of Manasseh located in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Merari, allocated according to their families, received twelve cities from the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelis apportioned these cities, along with their pasture lands, to the descendants of Levi by random lot, just as the Lord had commanded through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribes of the descendants of Judah and Simeon, they gave these cities, delineated by name:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the descendants of Aaron, one of the families of the descendants of Kohath, of the descendants of Levi, since the lot fell in their favor first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave them Kiriath-arba, also known as Hebron, (Arba was named after the ancestor of Anak), in the hill country of Judah, along with its surrounding pasture lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the fields adjoining the city and its surrounding villages were given to Jephunneh’s son Caleb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they gave Hebron to the descendants of Aaron the priest to serve as a city of refuge for unintentional killers, along with its pasture lands, Libnah with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jattir with its pasture lands, Eshtemoa with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Holon with its pasture lands, Debir with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ain with its pasture lands, Juttah with its pasture lands, and Beth-shemesh with its pasture lands, for a total of nine cities from these two tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Benjamin, Gibeon with its pasture lands, Geba with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anathoth with its pasture lands, and Almon with its pasture lands, for a total of four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of the cities allocated to the priests, who were descendants of Aaron, numbered thirteen, along with their pasture lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cities from the tribe of Ephraim were also allotted to the families of the descendants of Kohath, that is, to the rest of the descendants of Kohath, who were descendants of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shechem was allocated to them as a city of refuge for unintentional killers, along with its pasture lands, in the mountainous region of Ephraim, Gezer with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kibzaim with its pasture lands, and Beth-horon with its pasture lands, for a total of four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Dan were allocated Elteke with its pasture lands, Gibbethon with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aijalon with its pasture lands, and Gath-rimmon with its pasture lands, for a total of four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the half-tribe of Manasseh were allocated Taanach with its pasture lands and Gath-rimmon with its pasture lands, for a total of two cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the cities with their pasture lands for the families of the rest of the descendants of Kohath numbered ten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the descendants of Gershon (one of the Levitical families) from the half-tribe of Manasseh were allocated Golan in Bashan as a city of refuge for unintentional killers, along with its pasture lands, and Beeshterah with its pasture lands, for a total of two cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Issachar were allocated Kishion with its pasture lands, Daberath with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jarmuth with its pasture lands, and En-gannim with its pasture lands, for a total of four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Asher were allocated Mishal with its pasture lands, Abdon with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Helkath with its pasture lands, and Rehob with its pasture lands, for a total of four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee with its pasture lands were allocated as a city of refuge for the unintentional killer, Hammoth-dor with its pasture lands, and Kartan with its pasture lands, for a total of three cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the cities of the descendants of Gershon according to their families totaled thirteen, including their pasture lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Zebulun were allocated to the descendants of Merari (that is, the rest of the descendants of Levi) Jokneam with its pasture lands, Kartah with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dimnah with its pasture lands, and Nahalal with its pasture lands, for a total of four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Reuben were allocated Bezer with its pasture lands, Jahaz with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedemoth with its pasture lands, and Mephaath with its pasture lands, for a total of four cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Gad were allocated Ramoth in Gilead with its pasture lands, to serve as a city of refuge for the unintentional killer, Mahanaim with its pasture lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heshbon with its pasture lands, and Jazer with its pasture lands, for a total of four cities in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the entire allocation to the descendants of Merari (that is, the rest of the families of the descendants of Levi) according to their families totaled twelve cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of the cities of the descendants of Levi that had been set apart among the territorial possession of the Israelis totaled 48, along with their pasture lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These cities were each surrounded by pasture lands, as was the case with all of these cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord gave all of the land to Israel that he had promised to give their ancestors, and they took possession and settled there in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave them peace all around them, just as he had promised their ancestors. Not one of their enemies was able to oppose them—the Lord placed all of their enemies under their control.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not one of the good promises that the Lord had made to the house of Israel failed—all of them came about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, Joshua called together the descendants of Reuben, the descendants of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and told them, “You have done everything that Moses the servant of the Lord commanded you, and you have listened to me in everything that I commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You haven’t abandoned your relatives these past days to the present, and you have met the obligation contained in the commands of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord has given peace to your relatives, just as he told them. Therefore, proceed to your tents—to the land that is yours to possess—that Moses the servant of the Lord gave you east of the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only be very careful to keep the commands and the Law that Moses the servant of the Lord commanded you—that is, to love the Lord your God, to follow in all of his ways, to keep his commands, to stay close to him, and to serve him with all your heart and soul.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s how Joshua blessed them. Then he sent them on their way and they returned to their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Moses had made an allotment in Bashan to one half-tribe of Manasseh, but Joshua made an allotment west of the Jordan River to the other half-tribe of their relatives. So when Joshua sent them on their way back to their tents, he also blessed them by saying
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Return to your tents with great wealth, plenty of livestock, silver, gold, bronze, iron, and lots of clothing. Divide the spoil from your enemies among your relatives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Reuben, the descendants of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh went back to the land of Gilead, leaving the Israelis at Shiloh in the land of Canaan, for their territorial possession that they had inherited in accordance with the command of the Lord given through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they arrived at an area of the Jordan River that is in the land of Canaan, the descendants of Reuben, the descendants of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh constructed an altar there by the Jordan River, and it was very large.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Israelis heard about it, they announced, “Look here, the descendants of Reuben, the descendants of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have constructed an altar in Canaan’s frontier district of the Jordan River, on the side apportioned to the Israelis.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Israelis heard that announcement, the entire community of the Israelis gathered together at Shiloh in preparation for war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Israelis sent a delegation to the descendants of Reuben, the descendants of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead. They sent Eleazar’s son Phinehas the priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ten officials with him (one for each of the tribal families of Israel, each one of them a family leader among the tribes of Israel).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They approached the descendants of Reuben, the descendants of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead and told them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the entire community of the Lord has to say: ‘What is this treacherous act by which you have acted deceitfully against the God of Israel by turning away from following the Lord today, and by building yourselves an altar today, so you can rebel against the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isn’t the evil that happened at Peor enough for us, from which we have yet to be completely cleansed even to this point, and because of which a plague came upon the community of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then, are you turning away from following the Lord today? If you rebel against the Lord today, by tomorrow he will be angry with the entire community of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the land of your inheritance remains unclean, then cross back over into the land that the Lord possesses, and receive an inheritance among us. Don’t rebel against the Lord and against us by constructing an altar for yourselves besides the altar of the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Didn’t Zerah’s son Achan act treacherously with respect to the things banned by God, and as a result God became angry at the entire community of Israel? And that man was not the only one to die because of his iniquity.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Reuben, the descendants of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh answered the officials of the tribes of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The God of gods, the Lord, the God of gods, the Lord is the one who knows! And may Israel itself be aware that if this was an act of rebellion or an act of treachery against the Lord, may he not deliver us today!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we have built an altar for ourselves intended to turn us away from following the Lord, or to offer burnt offerings, grain offerings, or peace offerings on it, may the Lord himself demand an accounting from us!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we did this because we were concerned for a reason, since we thought, ‘Sometime in the future your descendants may say to our descendants, “What do you have in common with the Lord, the God of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has established the Jordan River to be a territorial border between us and you. Descendants of Reuben and descendants of Gad have no allotment from the Lord.” So your descendants may cause our descendants to stop fearing the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “That’s why we said, ‘Let’s build an altar for ourselves, not for burnt offerings or sacrifice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but instead it will serve as a reminder between us and you and between our generations after us, that we are to serve the Lord with our burnt offerings, sacrifices, and peace offerings. That way your descendants will not say to our descendants in the future, “You have no allotment from the Lord.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “That’s also why we said, ‘It may be if they say these things to us and to our descendants in the future, so we will respond, “Look at this replica of the altar of the Lord that our ancestors made, not for burnt offerings or sacrifice, but rather as a reminder between us and you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May we never rebel against the Lord today by building an altar for burnt offerings, for grain offerings, or for sacrifice to replace the altar of the Lord our God which stands before his Tent.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Phinehas the priest, the leaders of the community, and the heads of the families of Israel who were with him heard what the descendants of Reuben, the descendants of Gad, and the descendants of Manasseh said, they were pleased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Eleazar’s son Phinehas the priest replied to the descendants of Reuben, the descendants of Gad, and the descendants of Manasseh, “Today we’ve demonstrated that the Lord is among us, because you have not acted treacherously against the Lord. Now you have delivered the Israelis from the anger of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Eleazar’s son Phinehas the priest and the leaders returned from the descendants of Reuben, the descendants of Gad, and from the land of Gilead to the land of Canaan and to the people of Israel, bringing back word to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What they said pleased the people of Israel, so they blessed God and said no more about going up to attack them in war and to destroy the land where the descendants of Reuben and the descendants of Gad were living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Reuben and the descendants of Gad named the altar “Witness,” because they claimed, “It stands as a witness between us that the Lord is God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many years later, after the Lord had given peace between Israel and all its surrounding enemies, and after Joshua had become very old,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua called together all Israel, including their leaders, officials, judges, and tribal officers. He told them, “I am old now after having lived many years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have seen everything that the Lord your God has done to all of these nations on your behalf, because it has been the Lord your God who has been fighting on your behalf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now look, I have allocated these nations that remain as an inheritance for your tribes, including all of the nations that I have eliminated, from the Jordan River to the Mediterranean Sea to the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will expel them in front of you, driving them out of your sight. You will take possession of this land, just as the Lord your God promised you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stand very strong, then, so you can obey and carry out everything written in the Book of the Law of Moses, turning neither to the right nor to the left of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That way, you will not mingle with those nations that remain among you, nor mention the name of their gods, nor make oaths by them, nor serve them, nor worship them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, you are to hold fast to the Lord your God, as you have done today,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the Lord has expelled great and strong nations ahead of you. Now as for you, not a single man has been able to oppose you right to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A single man makes a thousand flee, because the Lord your God is the one who is fighting for you, just as he promised you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So be very diligent to love the Lord your God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because if you ever turn back and cling to those who remain of these nations by intermarrying with them and associating one with another,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: know for certain that the Lord your God will not continue to drive out these nations ahead of you. Instead, they will be a snare and a trap for you, a whip to your backs, and thorns in your eyes, until you perish from this good land that the Lord your God has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Look here: today I’m going down the path that everyone on earth takes, and you know with all your hearts and souls that not a single word of all of the good things that the Lord your God spoke about you has failed to happen. Everything has been fulfilled about you—not one of them has failed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, just as all of the good things have come about that the Lord your God promised, so also the Lord will bring upon you all of the threats until he has destroyed you from possessing this good land that he has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you break the covenant of the Lord your God that he commanded you to obey by going to serve other gods and worship them, then the anger of the Lord will blaze against you, and you will perish quickly from this good land that he gave you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua assembled together all of the tribes of Israel at Shechem. He called for the leaders, officials, judges, and tribal officers of Israel. They assembled in formation before God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and Joshua told all of the people, “This is what the Lord God of Israel has to say:
‘Long ago your ancestors lived beyond the Euphrates River, including Terah, father of both Abraham and Nahor, where they served other gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I took your ancestor Abraham from the other side of the Euphrates River and led him through the entire land of Canaan. I multiplied his descendants, and gave him his son Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave Jacob and Esau to Isaac. And I gave Mount Seir to Esau as his possession, but Jacob and his children went down to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Later I commissioned Moses and Aaron, and I inflicted plagues on Egypt by what I did among them. Afterwards, I brought all of you out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Then I brought your ancestors out of Egypt, and you came to the Sea, and the Egyptians followed your ancestors with chariots and horsemen to the Reed Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they cried out to the Lord, he placed darkness between you and the Egyptians, brought the sea upon the Egyptians, and swallowed them up. Your own eyes saw what I did in Egypt. Then you lived in the desert for a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I brought you into the territory of the Amorites, who lived on the other side of the Jordan River. They fought you, but I gave them into your control, and you took possession of their land. I destroyed them from your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Then Zippor’s son, King Balak of Moab, showed up and fought against Israel. He sent word to Balaam, summoning Beor’s son to put a curse on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I wasn’t willing to listen to Balaam. So he had to bless you, and I delivered you from his control.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Next, you crossed the Jordan River and arrived at Jericho. But the citizens of Jericho fought you, as did the Amorites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hittites, Girgashites, Hivites, and the Jebusites, so I gave them into your control.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Then I sent hornets ahead of you to drive out two kings of the Amorites before you without your using either sword or bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave you a land for which you never worked and cities that you didn’t build, but that you have lived in. You’re eating from vineyards and olive groves that you didn’t plant.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now you must fear the Lord and serve him in faithfulness and truth. Throw away the gods that your ancestors served beyond the Euphrates River and in Egypt. Instead, serve the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you think it’s the wrong thing for you to serve the Lord, then choose for yourselves today whom you will serve—the gods whom your ancestors served on the other side of the Euphrates River, or the gods of the Amorites in whose territories you are living. But as for me and my household, we will serve the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In response, the people said, “Far be it from us that we should abandon the Lord to serve other gods,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since the Lord our God is the one who brought us and our ancestors up from the land of Egypt, from a life of slavery. He did those great things right in front of us, preserving us along the way that we traveled and among all the peoples through whose territory we passed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord expelled all the people before us, including the Amorites who lived in the land. Therefore, we also will serve the Lord, since he is our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua told the people, “You will not be able to serve the Lord, because he is a God of Holiness. He is a jealous God, and he will forgive neither your transgressions nor your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you abandon the Lord and serve foreign deities, then he will turn and do you harm, consuming you after all the good he has done for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No,” the people replied to Joshua. “We will serve the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joshua responded, “You are giving testimony against yourselves, that you have chosen to serve the Lord.”
They replied, “We are witnesses!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said, “Therefore abandon the foreign gods that are among you, and turn your hearts to the Lord, the God of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people replied, “We will serve the Lord our God and obey his voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua made a covenant with the people that day, making statutes and ordinances in Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He wrote these words in the Book of the Law of God, took a large stone, moved it under the shade of the oak tree that was near the sanctuary of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then told all of the people, “Look! This stone will testify for us, because it has heard everything that the Lord has spoken to us. So it will stand as a witness against you in the event that you deny your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua dismissed the people, and each man returned to his territorial inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some time later, Joshua servant of the Lord died at the age of 110 years, and
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they buried him in his territorial inheritance at Timnath-serah in the mountainous region of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel served the Lord for the entire lifetimes of Joshua and of the officials who outlived Joshua, that is, the ones who had personally known everything that the Lord had done for Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also buried the bones of Joseph, which the Israelis brought up from Egypt, in the parcel of ground at Shechem that Jacob had purchased from the descendants of Shechem’s father Hamor, for 100 pieces of silver. It became part of the inheritance of the descendants of Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, Aaron’s son Eleazar also died, and they buried him at Gibeah, which belonged to his son Phinehas, and which had been given to him in the mountainous region of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator
